org.xflatdb.xflat

Interface Table<T>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConvertingTable, ElementTable

    public interface Table<T>
    Represents a table in the database. A Table provides CRUD access to the underlying XML data store, and converts to and from the generic type. This is the main interface to access data inside XFlat.

    • Method Detail

      • insert

        void insert(T row)
            throws DuplicateKeyException
        Inserts an object as a row in the database.
        Parameters:
        row - The value to insert as XML.
        Throws:
        DuplicateKeyException

      • find

        T find(java.lang.Object id)
        Finds one value by ID
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the value to find
        Returns:
        The row value, or null if the row does not exist.

      • findOne

        T findOne(XPathQuery query)
        Finds the first value matching the Xpath query.
        Parameters:
        query - The query to match.
        Returns:
        the value of the matched row, or null if no row was matched.

      • find

        Cursor<T> find(XPathQuery query)
        Gets a cursor over all the values matching the Xpath query.
        Parameters:
        query - The query to match.
        Returns:
        A cursor over each matching row.

      • findAll

        java.util.List<T> findAll(XPathQuery query)
        Gets a list of all the values matching the Xpath query. This is the same as find(org.xflatdb.xflat.query.XPathQuery) but without the hassle of a cursor.
        Parameters:
        query - The query to match.
        Returns:
        A list of all the matching values.

      • replace

        void replace(T newValue)
             throws KeyNotFoundException
        Replaces a value with the new value by ID. This is the same as "Save" in some other document databases.
        Parameters:
        newValue - The new value to replace the old value.
        Throws:
        KeyNotFoundException

      • replaceOne

        boolean replaceOne(XPathQuery query,
                 T newValue)
        Replaces the first value matched by the query with the new value.
        Parameters:
        query - The query to match.
        newValue - The new value to replace the row.
        Returns:
        true if the query matched any rows, false otherwise. If false, the new value was not inserted.

      • upsert

        boolean upsert(T newValue)
        Updates or inserts the row by ID.
        Parameters:
        newValue - The new value to replace or insert.
        Returns:
        false if an existing row was updated, true if a row was inserted.

      • update

        boolean update(java.lang.Object id,
             XPathUpdate update)
               throws KeyNotFoundException
        Applies an update to the data in a given row.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the row to match.
        update - The update to apply.
        Returns:
        true if the update actually applied, false if the row was found but the update did not select an existing document element.
        Throws:
        KeyNotFoundException - if the row does not exist.

      • update

        int update(XPathQuery query,
         XPathUpdate update)
        Applies an update to all data matching a given query.
        Parameters:
        query - The query to match.
        update - The update to apply to each matching row.
        Returns:
        the number of rows that were updated.

      • delete

        void delete(java.lang.Object id)
            throws KeyNotFoundException
        Deletes the row with the given ID.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the row to delete.
        Throws:
        KeyNotFoundException

      • deleteAll

        int deleteAll(XPathQuery query)
        Deletes all rows matching the given query.
        Parameters:
        query - The query selecting elements to delete.
        Returns:
        the number of rows that were deleted.
